title: Change in momentum in an experiment

content.question: For an impulse-momentum experiment, students collect data on a collision between blocks <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. A force probe attached to block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is used to measure the force exerted by block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time during the collision. The data collected shows a positive force that is used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The force sensor is removed from block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and attached to block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the experiment is run again. Which of the following correctly describes how this affects the data and if the impulse on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can still be determined?

choices.label: The data can only be used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, not block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> .

The data can only be used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, not block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The data cannot be used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> or block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The data can be used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The data can be used to determine the force on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The data can be used to determine the impulse on block <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and block <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext></mtext><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
